title-group.article-title: Nacelle Installation Effects on Propeller Blade Surface Pressure Distributions

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1988 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A system capable of measuring the time averaged surface pressure distributions on rotating model propeller blades has been developed. A wide range of test conditions have been investigated and results displaying the effects of changes in blade setting angle, advance ratio and number of blades on the blade surface pressures are presented In addition, the system has been used to experimentally investigate the influence of nacelle type afterbodies on the propeller blade pressure distribution.

ref.mixed-citation: W. H. Gray, and R.M. Hunt; Pressure distributions on the blade sections of the NACA 10 (3) (049)-03 propeller under operating conditions. NACA RM L50 A26, 1950.

D.T. Owen; Development of the pressure tapped model propeller system. AASU Memo 86/18.

D.W. Hurst, P. Methven, and D.T. Owen, Wind tunnel testing of small scale pressure tapped propellers. AASU Memo 86/15. (Presented at the Royal Aeronautical Society International Conference "Aerodynamics at Low Reynolds Numbers", London, 15-18 October 1986).
